intro: Randia rectispina, commonly known as the spined randia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. Randia rectispina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
